thread.title: Jamie Carragher "devastated" for Claudio Ranieri after Leicester axe - 'questions must be asked of the players'
thread.title_full: Jamie Carragher "devastated" for Claudio Ranieri after Leicester axe - 'questions must be asked of the players'

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Jamie Carragher "devastated" for Claudio Ranieri after Leicester axe - 'questions must be asked of the players'
text:
Ranieri has harshly been axed (Photo: Leicester City FC via Getty Images) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jamie Carragher admits he is "devastated" to see Leicester sack Claudio Ranieri. 
The Italian was sensationally axed on Thursday night following the Champions League defeat to Sevilla. 
Ranieri guided Leicester to a shock Premier League title success last term, having started the campaign as 5000-1 outsiders. 
This season has been one to forget though, with Leicester just one point above the relegation zone ahead of the visit of Liverpool. 
Nevertheless, Carragher has slammed the decision and suggested the players should take responsibility. Ranieri has been axed by Leicester (Photo: Getty) Ranieri celebrates with the Premier League trophy (Photo: Getty Images) Read More 
"After last night [the Sevilla defeat], I cannot believe it," he told Sky Sports. 
"I am devastated for Ranieri and questions need to be asked of those players and the board. 
"If anyone has changed, it is the players and not the manager. 
"Maybe it has gone to their head and they've got carried away. Last season was a freak, we all know Leicester's players aren't of that quality. 
"There will never be a bigger story in football. He should have a statue for what he has achieved and now he has gone, they should start it in the morning." Carragher has slammed the decision (Photo: Getty Images) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
